MEANINGS.PATTERN: differentiate [sth] | differentiate between [sth] and [sth] | differentiate [sth] from [sth]
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To recognize or ascertain what makes (someone or something) different; to perceive the difference between two or more things.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 区分，辨别；看出或指出（某人或某事物）的差异
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It's often hard to differentiate between genuine and fake designer products.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 区分真假名牌产品往往很难。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make (someone or something) different in some way; to alter or develop so as to be distinctive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使...不同；使...具有特色；使区别开来
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Companies strive to differentiate their services from those of their competitors.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 公司努力使他们的服务与竞争对手的服务有所不同。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Biology) To develop different characteristics in a specialized way. (Mathematics) To find the derivative of (a function or equation).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (生物学) 分化；(数学) 求导数
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Stem cells have the remarkable ability to differentiate into various cell types.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 干细胞具有分化成各种细胞类型的非凡能力。
